title: Small scale miners kick against increase in EPA permit fees
text:
18:06 CET Small scale miners kick against increase in EPA permit fees By MyJoyOnline 
Small scale miners are kicking against the increase in the Environmental Protection Agency’s permit fees for their sector. 
According to them, the fees have gone up from seven hundred and twenty Ghana cedis to nine thousand six hundred Ghana cedis following the passage of the Fees and Charges Amendment Instrument last year. 
The Public Relations Officer of the Ghana National Association of Small Scale Miners, Francis Opoku said the over a thousand percent increase could only encourage illegal mining. 
“The permit fee for small scale mines rose from È¼750 to $2,400 ($ 300 for processing and $ 2,100 for permit) he stressed. 
The Small Scale Miners PRO noted that even though Parliament approved the fees and charges, it is still on the high side. 
He could not fathom why the Minerals Commission which is the main agency for issuing mining leases and digging permits have kept its processing and consideration fees at a lower rate GHÈ¼250.00 and GHÈ¼550.0 respectively and the EPA is rather charging exorbitant prices. 
Mr. Opoku is optimistic government would heed to their plea and streamline all fees and charges in the small scale mining sector. 
The Association also kicked against the dollarization of the fees. They are asking to EPA to stick to the Bank of Ghana’s directive for local services to be priced in the local currency. 
Story by Ghana/Joy Business
